reviews.text: Excellent everything! Food was delicious and the service was even better! By far the best most personal and attentive service I have got in a long while. The restaurant is small and intimate which makes it even better. You really feel the love and like you are eating in their home!

A hidden gem in the center of Sofia ‚ù§Ô∏è
My friend took me to this restaurant a while back, and I fell in love with the place from the moment I stepped in. The decoration is rustic, artistic, and very cozy. It smells like delicious Italian food, and you can feel your mouth starting to salivate.
The lady spoke great English, which for some reason seems to be hard to find in Sofia, and she showed one of the best hospitality in a long while. Very welcoming and considerate.
They offer a great selection of pasta and salads, and honestly, I dont think you can go wrong with anything you decide.
The only downside was that we went in during busy hours during the season, when most people were on holiday break, so she was the only waitress. We had to wait to order desserts, bill, drinks but none the less, you will not regret coming here. Just imagine you're in Italy where people are very chill and there is enough time in the world for everything ü§≠
Thank you for the great night, and see you soon ü©∑

I found this place on google and after reading all the good reviews I decided to give it a chance and I have to admit that the food and the service was beyond my expectations. The food was so delicious and large portions. You can tell from the first bite that they use the best quality of products which is not common because not many restaurants use good quality of products but this restaurant does. The service is beyond the best. The staff really makes feel like home. The nice lady always gave great advices probably from experience. This combination of amazing food and great service is not easy to find. The prices are reasonable for the quality of the food and the service. I really enjoyed and recommend this restaurant to everyone.
